column9: Overnight Capital Cost dollar per kW including Contingency
column11: Overnight Capital Cost dollar per kW
column24: Fixed O M dollar per kW
column25: Variable O M dollar per MWh
column26: Calculated OM All Inclusive Cost Term ($/kW)
column38: Dataset name
Title

column1: Unique identifier for this data record.
column2: Displayed label for the technology and sub-technology.
column3: General type of technology used to generate electricity.
column7: Levelized cost of energy, an estimate of total electricity cost including payback of initial investment and operating costs. Also the price a plant must sell electricity at in order to break even.
column9: Overnight Capital Cost dollar per kW including Contingency.
column11: Initial cost of a generation technology per kilowatt of capacity, if it could be conducted overnight.
column13: Discount Rate is the assumed effective rate at which future income streams are discounted. Used to compute the capital recovery factor. In Normalized mode, a single discount rate is used. In Market and User modes, the discount rate can be different for each technology.
column15: Lifetime of the Investment. It is the assumed lifetime of a new plant/vehicle and the period over which the investment is computed (unless specified otherwise).
column16: (CRF) A common element in the levelized cost calculations is capital expenditures. The capital expenditure is turned into annual payments with a Capital Recovery Factor (CRF) that is defined using a common calculation.
column17: Tax rate paid (applied after depreciation credits).
column18: The present value of depreciation, depending on the MACRS schedule (Modified Accelerated Cost Recovery System).
column19: The ratio between average power and peak capacity. A plant running at full capacity for exactly half the year would have a 0.5 capacity factor.
column22: Capital Cost term calculated in the LCOE equation
column24: Maintenance costs for generation paid regardless of the total amount generated.
column25: Maintenance costs for generation paid per unit of energy produced.
column26: Term calculated using the OM All Inclusive Cost - when used, this replaces the fixed and variable O&M costs ($/kW).
column27: Term calculated using the Fixed OM ($/kW).
column28: Term calculated using the Variable OM ($/kW).
column29: Calculated term for all costs associated with OM (Operations and Maintenance).
column38: Dataset name.
